data.title: Chef is originally from So. America, so the casual food features a South American twist - wonderful salads using quinoa!
data.text: I join about 12 ladies there for lunch every Monday -  all like the food.   The ambience is ordinary, with the exception of being in an old restored building!  Prices are very reasonable - wine and beer served.

data.title: Best food, worst service
data.text:
The lunch menu is honestly the best in town. The Tuscan Chicken sandwich is....brilliant perfection. You aren't giving up anything with the wonderfully taste-and-tummy satisfying quinoa salad with balsamic dressing. I really can't choose between the two on any given day. My friend had the shrimp quesadillas and said they were divine. The French dip is also delicious, and I'd take that any time, though the Tuscan chicken or quinoa salad are my faves. They are in a wonderful location, right off of the charming down town district of Idaho Falls. 
The owner is very nice, and the staff are very personable and friendly when you can get their attention. They are successful enough during lunch to hire a table busser (who should also be able to run food), which they desperately need to do. They are grossly understaffed for the lunch crowd they pull in. We sat at a table for 45 minutes without even getting water. I finally went to the counter and asked for it myself. That got the attention of the server, who finally showed up. The staff needs trained on time management (doing more than one thing at a time, like bringing food to one table and turning around and taking an order from a different table on the same trip across the restaurant). They were apologetic and nice and the freshly made food is perfect, but that didn't quite make up for the 2 hours spent there for lunch making us miss or be late for other commitments. This isn't a one time thing. It's every. Single. Time. Consistently best lunch food in town. Consistently slowest service in town.  I had to give overall of 3, which is regrettable.

data.title: Great find.
data.text: This little deli is located in an old high school. I had the Mango, Strawberry, Avocado and Arugula Salad which was fabulous. My husband had the Chivito (Uruguayan Sandwich) which he loved. The food took a bit of time to get to the table, but was worth the wait.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: I have lived near here for 8 years and never knew about this. Food was very fresh and tasty. Prices are a little high but love that they use food from local resources. My son ordered flan and didnt like it. They noticed that he didn't eat much. And took it off our bill, that was not expected and very nice. I will go again for sure!

data.title: Great food, service and atmosphere
data.text:
Had the Italian Chickens  sandwich. Wonderful!!!
There are many fast food restaurants. This one is a treasure. Fresh and fantastic.

data.title: Not satisfied, food was very mediocre.
data.text: I ordered the french dip a side salad and lemon bar. All of which were very bland. The service was decent. The food was very boring, I would not refer nor go back.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: My wife and I went for lunch at the Arugula at my son's advise. What a delight to have meat on a sandwich that actually has taste- pork tasting like pork, beef tasting like beef with just enough spices to make it tasty. I had the Uruguayan sandwich- steak, ham, bacon, grilled onions- and it was not only delicious but filling. My son had the Bolivian sandwich. I never tasted a pork sandwich that good. Unfortunately, my wife had a pretty tasteless mango, strawberry, avocado and arugula salad- pretty ordinary to say the least. I will definitely return to the Arugula Deli on my next trip to Idaho Falls.

data.title: Fresh food
data.text: This deli is a great find, hidden in the downtown area. They offer a variety of fresh unique dishes. I had a Hawaiian salad with chicken that had coconut and fresh pineapple with amazing dressing. If you like fresh food you will love this place!

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text:
Tucked away in the corner of a repurposed vintage Jr. High building is this Hidden Gem. 
 The first thing you notice is how exceptionally clean it is. I was served by a lovely young woman named Audrey that balanced perky and attentive perfectly without being overbearing. I ordered the Chivito sandwich. They do serve beer and wine from a limited list and I has a Stella Artois with my meal. I recommend being hungry if you decide to dine here,they do not skimp on portions. Don't let the slightly older neighborhood it's in allow you to not visit. My mother lives alone a minutes walk from the front door and I can assure you it's quite safe.

data.title: Hidden Eatery with Brazilian “lemonade”
data.text:
We were on a road trip and wanted to find a quick place to eat lunch.  Our Google map directions were sending us into a residential neighborhood that didn’t look promising for finding a deli.  We rounded the corner of an art deco style brick school building and there it was!  Tucked into the bottom floor we found Arugula.  Sparsely furnished but bright with both indoor an outdoor seating.  Our waiter was welcoming and was willing to make suggestions and elaborations about the menu choices.  
On a hot day the Brazilian lemonade, made with LIMES & sweetened condensed milk, was a treat and went perfectly with the salad and sandwich we ordered.  At this place I would order sandwiches for their uniqueness.  The El Chacarero with meat and greens was delicious.  The roasted beet salad was tasty but did not stand out from the same recipe at other places.  Prices are very reasonable.  
Arugula felt more like a lunch café than a deli so the name is a bit misleading but is worth every bite.  A place we would recommend and return to if we pass through Idaho Fall again.

data.title: Come hungry!
data.text: We stopped here on our way from Salt Lake City to Yellowstone and were not disappointed. Delicious sandwiches and salads. Try the special ingredient lemonade and leave room for the huge homemade desserts.

data.title: Fabulous fresh food
data.text: Fabulous fresh food -- perfect spot for lunch when driving between Salt Lake City to Jackson WY.  Something perfect for everyone in our group:  wraps, salads, sandwiches.  But everything very different  -- atypical fare and really delicious.  Do not miss the jalapeño cilantro dressing!

data.title: Healthy Surprise for Vegetarians
data.text: My husband and I found ourselves on a unexpected detour in Idaho Falls for a truck repair.  While waiting, we figured we would just have to settle for a luncheon location.  We stumbled upon Arugula Deli and WOW! were we pleasantly surprised at their vegetarian selections.  I had the taco salad and they readily added my extras and my husband had the veggie wrap which wasn't the least  bit skimpy.  Our waiter was the effervescent Jordan who seemed to never quit smiling.  If you are looking for a quality lunch at a great price and good service, don't miss this deli!

data.title: Best deli in Idaho Falls
data.text: This is if not near the best food in the local area. Everything is fresh made in the kitchen done by a very talented staff who is very concerned with taste and qualify.

data.title: Variety of Sandwiches from Different Countries
data.text: This deli has lots of different sandwiches and salads.  The sandwiches are from different countries.  The side salad that came with the sandwich was made from fresh greens; not from a bag.  They offer a choice of lemon, cucumber or regular water. The sandwiches were very tasty.  We will be back.

data.title: Wonderful Deli
data.text: This is one of the best places for lunch in Idaho Falls. I love their quinoa salads so much that I haven't tried anything else! We are planning on trying their dinner menu in the near future. This deli is a treasure you won't want to miss.

data.title: Fresh, unique, DELICIOUS.
data.text: Stumbled upon this GEM. Lots of variety here and everything is super fresh and amazing. They know what they're doing here!!!

data.title: Unique Eats
data.text: Decided to take an actual lunch and stumbled upon this hidden gem.  The menu is full of amazing and unique combinations.  Whether you are in the mood for a salad or a sandwich, this place will have something to satisfy everyone.  I was a big fan of the skirt steak sandwich myself.

data.title: This is a 5 Star Lunch
data.text: I don't give 5 stars unless a place is truly exceptional. There are a lot of good places, but the food served here at Arugula is done with pride. Concerning the food, every detail is thought out. First the salad is a mix of fresh green leaf and red lettuce. The Italian dressing was outstanding. Shaved carrots, cucumbers and tomatoes come with the leaves. The Tuscan sandwich has sauteed onions, chopped peppers, tomatoes, sliced chicken breast and a green paste-sauce. Time was put into my one, single, sandwich - and everyone else's too. What is the pureed goodness on this sandwich? My wife got the chivito sandwich: strips of thinly sliced, spiced meat, egg, puree sauce, gooey cheese (mozz.?) just a tremendous taste.  The bread on both sandwiches was a thinner, deliciously, crusty bread. Carrot cake, again, completely original, chocolate bottom, separated by cream, carrot on top with flecks of chocolate. The cook is making creations, not heating up crappy food off a truck.   The restaurant is in an old school. So the setting isn't great, no dividers between tables, but who cares with food like this?! Two people, sandwiches and carrot cake $35. When I took the pics of food and the kitchen, you could tell, he was just proud - and he should be!

data.title: The best salad and sandwich
data.text: We stopped at Arugula to see if it was as good as people say, and it certainly was! This place is a bit hard to find, basically on the south end of a re-purposed Junior High School, but don't let that dissuade you. South American sandwiches? Yep, A real treat from Argentina and Bolivia where they know meat. Unique and not cheap, but excellent with a superb staff to help you have a great dining experience.
